thread.title: John Terry gashes ankle in training, posts gruesome video of doctor stitching it up
thread.title_full: John Terry gashes ankle in training, posts gruesome video of doctor stitching it up

author: David Pasztor
title: John Terry gashes ankle in training, posts gruesome video of doctor stitching it up
text: Rec John Terry has traveled with the rest of the Chelsea squad to Burnley but is likely to miss Sunday’s game after picking up an ankle injury in training. And by injury we mean a nice big gash (and developing bruise) right over the bone. John Terry set to miss #cfc match at Burnley due to picking up an ankle injury in training.obviously would have only been on the bench — Simon Johnson (@sjstandardsport) February 11, 2017 By the looks of it, it’s just an impact injury, which should not rule him out for too long (when compared with a strain, for example), but given how recently it was stitched up, it’s probably better to keep it out of any potential match action. The apparently not very squeamish Terry posted this rather gruesome video of the ankle getting stitched up after the training ground clash. Injured John Terry is surely out of Chelsea's match at Burnley pic.twitter.com/ZjIqUPPwDx — 101 Great Goals (@102greatgoals) February 11, 2017 Terry wasn’t likely to start of course, but he’s been a regular on the bench since Branislav Ivanović left for Zenit St. Petersburg. If JT isn’t available for bench duty on Sunday, he’s likely to be replaced by young Nathan Aké, who was not in the matchday squad for either the Liverpool or the Arsenal game.
